data.value: Strong financial performance with sustained volume growth in 2022.
Inflationary pressures and rising interest rates are concerns for customer demand.
Invested in new production line in Delta.
Lease will not be extended beyond June 2023.
Initiated production from new processing facility in Delta, BC in Q3 2020.
Completed efficiency enhancement project in Q2 2018 and expanded capacity in 2016.
Successful establishment of the brand as a leading chemical free processor.
Established customer base across North America and internationally.
Sold through key distribution channels including roaster retailers and coffee importers.
Raised capital in 2015, 2016, 2018, 2019, and 2022 for production lines.
Highly regarded management team with substantial experience.
100% chemical free process with a focus on sustainability and environmental responsibility.

data.value: The rise and fall of the NY’C affects our volume of shipments, revenues, cost of sales, and working capital requirements.
US$1.77/lb compared to US$2.20/lb in Q4 2021.
Exposure to changes in US$/C$ exchange rates affects profitability and cash generation.
In upward trending markets, customers consume inventories rather than build them.
When the NY’C declines, customers tend to add inventories.
The NY’C has experienced volatility, with an average of US$2.13/lb in 2022.

elements.title: Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements

data.value: The Company has elected not to recognize right-of-use assets and lease liabilities for short-term leases of machinery and leases of low-value assets. Lease payments are recognized as an expense on a straight-line basis. Depreciation charge for right-of-use assets and interest expense on lease liabilities is reported in the consolidated income statement. Principal repayments of lease liabilities are listed under financing activities.

data.key: Current and Deferred Income Taxes Summary
data.value: Income tax expense comprises current and deferred tax. It is recognized in the consolidated statement of income and comprehensive income, except for items recognized in other comprehensive income or directly in equity. The current income tax charge is based on tax laws in effect at the reporting date.

elements.title: Accounts Payable and Contractual Cash Flows
SWISS WATER DECAFFEINATED COFFEE INC. Management Discussion and Analysis

data.value: Cash from operations may fluctuate with the performance of the business, which can be susceptible to a number of risks. These risks may include, but are not limited to, foreign exchange fluctuations, labour relations, coffee prices, the availability of coffee, competition from existing chemical and other natural or chemical free coffee decaffeinators, competition from new entrants, environmental and regulatory risks, customer concentration, commodity futures losses, ability to maintain organic certification, risks related to information technology, dependence on key personnel, product liability, uncollectable debts, liquidity risk and timing and costs of capital projects.

elements.title: Risk Factors Related to Business Operations

data.value: Decommissioning of facilities, ability to raise funds, availability of labor force, inflation, changes in interest rates, global pandemics, economic downturns.
Demand for products, delays in transportation, increase in costs, potential shifts in customer supply sources.
Risks related to air, water, waste and land affecting operations.
Environmental conditions affecting the supply and quality of green coffee.
Maintaining supplier diversity, keeping inventory, developing coffee blends.

Subject to environmental laws; compliance monitored routinely.
Expecting increased costs for energy and water consumption.
Potential unknown environmental impacts related to business.

elements.title: Hedge Accounting and Risk Management Policies

data.value: Hedges on coffee purchase commitments and coffee inventory.
Hedges related to US$ denominated future process revenues.
Implemented to manage unpredictability in coffee commodity prices and foreign exchange rates.
Gains and losses are recorded until the coffee is sold and matched to sales.
Used to hedge foreign exchange cash flow variability of expected US$ processing fee revenue.
Higher percentage of expected future revenues is hedged in the immediate 12-month period than in the 13 to 60-month period.

elements.title: Key audit matter: Application of hedge accounting for derivative financial instruments

data.value: The Company uses derivative financial instruments and applies hedge accounting to manage and hedge commodity price risks and foreign currency risks.
Derivative financial instruments are designated as hedging instruments.
Changes in fair value of designated coffee inventory and hedged firm commitments are managed to cope with risk of commodity price changes.
Designated purchase commitments are hedged items in a fair value hedge relationship for foreign exchange changes.
Hedging instruments designated in a fair value relationship amounted to $3.3 million (derivative assets: $3.4 million, derivative liabilities: $0.1 million) as at December 31, 2022.
Gains/losses on the hedging instruments impact the consolidated statement of income.
Procedures included assessing hedge documentation, testing operating effectiveness, evaluating hedge effectiveness, and confirming underlying hedging instruments.

elements.title: Responsibilities of management and those charged with governance for the consolidated financial statements

data.value: Management is responsible for the preparation and fair presentation of the consolidated financial statements in accordance with IFRS.
Management is responsible for internal control to enable preparation of financial statements free from material misstatement.
Management must assess the Company’s ability to continue as a going concern.
To obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free from material misstatement.
Identify and assess risks of material misstatement, design audit procedures responsive to those risks.
Exercise professional judgment and maintain professional skepticism during the audit.
Understand internal control relevant to the audit but not express an opinion on its effectiveness.
